channel.title: [DELTA]Clickingmost.Java help[DELTA] (Rep++!)
channel.description:
317 DELTA Okay, so i'm trying to make it so when a player clicks on one of my interface buttons (in a custom interface) it allows him to open up the Pk Point Shop. In my clickingmost.java I have tried this, but it does not work.
case 43025: c.WanneShop = 1; break;
WanneShop 1 being the shop I want the interface button to open. The error from the compiler I get it:
error: WanneShop has private access in client c.WannaShop = 1; ^
If anyone can provide some insight on how to fix this, it would be greatly appreciated and I will rep++!

item.title: [DELTA]Clickingmost.Java help[DELTA] (Rep++!)
item.dc:creator: @deathbysniper97 deathbysniper97
item.description:
@deathbysniper97 wrote:

Yes, as Elven said, I’d recommend trying to make it a public declaration rather than private. It will allow the file to be accessed by other files that are necessary.

Read full topic

item.title: [DELTA]Clickingmost.Java help[DELTA] (Rep++!)
item.dc:creator: @3lv3n_snip3r 3lv3n snip3r
item.description:
@3lv3n_snip3r wrote:

I would but I haven’t worked with Delta for a couple years now. Push comes to shove Lol.

Read full topic

item.title: [DELTA]Clickingmost.Java help[DELTA] (Rep++!)
item.dc:creator: @JGX JGX
item.description:
@JGX wrote:

I’ll try that. If worse comes to worse I can always make one. Well thanks for the help guys and if anyone has the code feel free to post it!

Still wish I could Rep… ffs not

Read full topic

item.title: [DELTA]Clickingmost.Java help[DELTA] (Rep++!)
item.dc:creator: @ohokay ohokay
item.description:
@ohokay wrote:

I’m sure there is already one, I haven’t touched shops in so long but every recent source should. Just look around for it

Read full topic

item.title: [DELTA]Clickingmost.Java help[DELTA] (Rep++!)
item.dc:creator: @JGX JGX
item.description:
@JGX wrote:

Damn, well is there any way I can make one from scratch? After all, DELTA is the easiest to make new codes in. (My opinion) I made my own timers, as well as dropped, used, and purchased item codes that keep track of all items dropped, used , or purchased for my stock exchange feature.

Read full topic

item.title: [DELTA]Clickingmost.Java help[DELTA] (Rep++!)
item.dc:creator: @ohokay ohokay
item.description:
@ohokay wrote:

Is there not a method that opens the shops… Like c.openShop(id);

Read full topic

item.title: [DELTA]Clickingmost.Java help[DELTA] (Rep++!)
item.dc:creator: @JGX JGX
item.description:
@JGX wrote:

Okay, so I am assuming that making it a public int allows that code to be shared within the other files in my server as apposed to just being able to use it in the client.java when it is a private int?

I switched it, no problems but it still doesn’t open the shop. Just stays on the same interface when you click the button.

Read full topic

item.title: [DELTA]Clickingmost.Java help[DELTA] (Rep++!)
item.dc:creator: @3lv3n_snip3r 3lv3n snip3r
item.description:
@3lv3n_snip3r wrote:

No, it shouldn’t change anything.

Read full topic

item.title: [DELTA]Clickingmost.Java help[DELTA] (Rep++!)
item.dc:creator: @JGX JGX
item.description:
@JGX wrote:

3lv3n snip3r:

Find out where WanneShop Is declared and make it a public int, instead of a private int.

Okay lol, well switching it from a private int to a public int wouldn’t mess anything up, would it?

That’s stupid that they removed Karma. I haven’t been on here in a couple months and I just noticed law.

Read full topic

item.title: [DELTA]Clickingmost.Java help[DELTA] (Rep++!)
item.dc:creator: @3lv3n_snip3r 3lv3n snip3r
item.description:
@3lv3n_snip3r wrote:

Yea, it wouldn’t of mattered, I had 200 Rep whenever it was taken out.
